body:
It's not related to 1.25, but a longstanding bug .....  due to abused ORM & SQL

And there are other similar issues (duplicate), but I can't find them at the moment (difficult to search ...)

rename.from: Pull requests show -1 after merge in 1.25.0
rename.to: Pull requests show negative number -1 after merge

body:
OK, found one: Pull requests number showing "-1" (negative PR count) #27472

The number of pull requests is different from the actual total in the list. #35168

Negative numbers in menu pull request #34927

The total number of PRs in the repositorie's PR label column is incorrect #34548

I am re-opening / keeping this one open. It really got worse. I can even make it count more in negative by closing + reopening the PR.

And this never happened prior to upgrading to 1.25.0
switched to postgres but it did not solve the issue, now PR counter does not work.

> I am re-opening / keeping this one open. It really got worse. I can even make it count more in negative by closing + reopening the PR.
> 
> And this never happened prior to upgrading to 1.25.0

Agree - I've had this happen sporadically previously, but now it's happening frequently. I can force a stats resync and it'll fix it (or restart the gitea container), but then it happens again immediately on the next PR

Could this issue be reproduced consistently?
I found an example on https://gitea.com/gitea/gitea-mcp where num_pulls is incorrect but num_closed_pulls is correct.

Could someone share the related SQL queries and other relevant logs when this issue occurs?

issue.title: Fix incorrect pull request counter

repository.name: gitea
repository.description: Git with a cup of tea! Painless self-hosted all-in-one software development service, including Git hosting, code review, team collaboration, package registry and CI/CD

issue.body:
Fix #35781, #27472

The PR will not correct the wrong numbers automatically. 

There is a cron task `check_repo_stats` which will be run when Gitea start or midnight. It will correct the numbers.

body:
Yes. For the first, I sent #35819 used the same method as you.
Thank you very much. I think this is the real problem and I will update #35819 to include this fix.
I have updated #35819 to include the second fix.

Yes I can reproduce, it happens every single time.

(1)

```
Nov 02 08:24:05 git gitea[942232]: 2025/11/02 08:24:05 .../issues/issue_update.go:372:NewIssueWithIndex() [I] [SQL] UPDATE repository SET num_pulls=(SELECT count(*) FROM issue WHERE is_pull=$1 AND repo_id=$2) WHERE id=$3 [true 294 294] - 1.223935ms
```

This to me is not right. Its good for regular crons when they fix numbers, but during a request this will cause race conditions, it should be atomic: `UPDATE repository SET num_pulls = num_pulls + 1`

(2)

This is though the part that looks wrong to me:

```
ov 02 08:24:06 git gitea[942232]: 2025/11/02 08:24:06 models/db/context.go:168:txWithNoCheck() [I] [SQL] UPDATE "repository" SET "owner_id" = $1, "owner_name" = $2, "lower_name" = $3, "name" = $4, "default_branch" = $5, "default_wiki_branch" = $6, "num_pulls" = $7, "num_closed_pulls" = $8, "size" = $9, "git_size" = $10, "object_format_name" = $11, "num_action_runs" = (SELECT count(*) FROM action_run WHERE repo_id=$12), "num_closed_action_runs" = (SELECT count(*) FROM action_run WHERE repo_id=$13 AND status IN ($14,$15,$16,$17)) WHERE "id"=$18 [2 xxx abc abc main main 10 10 1417424 1417424 sha1 294 294 success failure cancelled skipped 294] - 2.498754ms
```

the "10" / "10" is not right because this happens right after a PR was opened. It should be 11/10 (which then gets corrected after restart).

is this maybe related to changes on action-runs? Because I am using gitea actions and this log happens right after a actions trigger?
It seems that (2) comes from this function: So add this can solve it?

You can see that SQL (1) executed in `2025/11/02 08:24:05` which updated the the repo issue number (to 11 I think).
Then after 1 second, the SQL (2) revert the repo issue number to 10.
Maybe we can try to add `Cols` first to see whether this issue can be fixed.

issue.body:
Fix #35781, #27472
Backport #35819 

The PR will not correct the wrong numbers automatically.

There is a cron task `check_repo_stats` which will be run when Gitea start or midnight. It will correct the numbers.
